title: Château des Quat'Sos
text:
The Château des Quat'Sos is a <a href="ch%C3%A2teau">château</a> in <a href="La%20R%C3%A9ole">La Réole</a>, <a href="Gironde">Gironde</a>, <a href="Nouvelle-Aquitaine">Nouvelle-Aquitaine</a>, <a href="France">France</a>. The name is of Gascon origin, describing the identical appearance of the four corner towers, the "Four Sisters". The castle is located on the promontory overlooking the confluence of the <a href="Garonne">Garonne</a> and the tributary Charros.
In 1224, permission was granted by King <a href="Louis%20VIII%20of%20France">Louis VIII of France</a> to build a castle. The castle was completed by King <a href="Henry%20III%20of%20England">Henry III of England</a>, while Duke of Aquitaine, to defend the English <a href="Duchy%20of%20Gascony">Duchy of Gascony</a>. During the <a href="Hundred%20Years%27%20War">Hundred Years' War</a>, the castle was fiercely disputed between English and French.
